comments.body:
Hm, this unrolls the `PutRecordsResponse` so the user can't actually react on a non-zero `failedRecordCount`. I guess the records with errors will be missing in the response, that's why the old implementation had some correlation logic.
Ideas?

The [`PutRecordsResultEntry`](https://sdk.amazonaws.com/java/api/latest/software/amazon/awssdk/services/kinesis/model/PutRecordsResultEntry.html) is enough to determine whether an error occurred at the record level (via `errorCode`), isn't it?

Ok, I didn't discover that API.
The examples should show something along the lines of
```
  .map { response =>
    if (response.errorCode != 0) throw new RuntimeException(...)
    response
  }
```
so that users understand it is their responsibility to check for response errors.
